item.title: Foreign Coding Interview Measures in the leetcode Era
item.description: Make a note of measures such as GAFAM or FAANG, or software engineer interview measures that tend to be similar to those (such as Indeed or PFN in Tokyo). #Coding interview and leetcode Foreign IT companies place great importance on coding interviews when hiring software engineers. It’s more like a programming contest problem, which is easier than business coding, and it seems common sense that American students and engineers take a few months of proactive measures when they receive an IT company.

item.title: A function that makes you think that Itching is out of reach... in Python
item.description: This is a collection of Python techniques, small tips and tricks useful for everyday programming. We have confirmed the operation with Python 3.8.0. Comparison of 3 or more values 1 == 2 == 3 # -> False 1 <2 <3 <4 # -> True Time (datetime/date) comparison Flexible comparisons are possible thanks to magic methods. Reference: [Python] Allow comparison operation in original class from datetime import date feb1 = date(2020, 2, 1) feb2 = date(2020, 2, 2) feb3 = date(2020, 2, 3) feb1 <feb2 <= feb2 <feb3 # -> True Maximum/minimum time from datetime import date # Intentionally reverse order dates = [ date(2020, 2, 3), date(2020, 2, 2), date(2020, 2, 1), ] min(dates) # -> datetime.

item.title: Minimal implementation for doing UnionFind in Python
item.description: Hello! I am happy. Sometimes I had problems with UnionFind, but I tended to use other people’s libraries, so I’ll write about it as a review. If you think that it’s like a forgetful personal note Important example AtCoder Typical Contest 001 B-Union Find https://atcoder.jp/contests/atc001/tasks/unionfind_a Union Find’s pure problem An explanation slide is also attached, so I will follow along with this. https://www.slideshare.net/chokudai/union-find-49066733 Union find (primary set data structure) from AtCoder Inc

item.title: I thought about how to learn programming for free.
item.description: # Background I thought about a low-cost way to learn programming from an empty situation. (Mac) Is the continuation of. This time, I summarized how to take a smartphone and learn the program for free for those who are new to buying a PC. OPAC-Library search system Perhaps it is OPAC that university graduates know but middle and high school graduates do not. If you are a university, you will be asked at the first orientation of your first year to search for books, magazines, papers, etc.

item.title: By clarifying the difference between statistics and machine learning, I can see why many business companies cannot use machine learning!
item.description: #What is the difference between statistics and machine learning? Why can't I predict from machine learning today and make money? Perhaps everyone wonders when they start studying machine learning. And why can’t many business companies use it for their daily work today? The question also comes up. There are various documents, but I was having trouble comprehending them, so I rearranged them myself. I’m putting together a lot of information by combining information.

item.title: Requirements definition-Article that can become a person who can design a system
item.description: ## Introduction Have you ever experienced programming while studying programming? ** “I can’t make a product even after studying” ** ** “How do you do development in the first place?” ** What is the requirement definition? In order to solve that problem, let’s first understand the overall feeling of development. See “Software development process” below The programming I’m always studying corresponds to the “implementation” part. In other words, there are as many as four walls before you can exercise your programming skills.

item.title: Process huge excel files with Python to improve productivity
item.description: >This article was published in November 2019 by [Benedikt Droste](https://towardsdatascience.com/@droste.benedikt),"[BoostyourefficiencyandprocessExcel-fileswithPython](https://towardsdatascience.com/boost-your-efficiency-and-process-excel-files-with-python-cae650c85d6c)‚Äù. This article is published with the permission of the original author. When you’re working with data, you inevitably come into contact with Excel. Even if you don’t use it for yourself, it will be needed by clients and colleagues. Excel excels in spreadsheets with small datasets. But I always lamented when I saw an Excel sheet with tens of thousands of rows and hundreds of columns.
